meanings.definition: A building used for public Christian worship.
meanings.sent1: Every Sunday, my family goes to the church near our house.
meanings.sent2: The church on the corner of the street has a beautiful stained glass window.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally walked into the church thinking it was a library - oops!
meanings.sent4: The church stood tall like a guardian watching over the town.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the church bells echoed through the quiet village.

meanings.sent1: My grandparents belong to a small church that follows different traditions.
meanings.sent2: The Baptist church down the road has a lively congregation.
meanings.sent3: I never knew there were so many variations of church beliefs until I visited different ones.
meanings.sent4: In our family, loyalty to our church is as strong as our bond with each other.
meanings.sent5: The church's teachings shaped my understanding of faith and community.

meanings.definition: The clergy or officialdom of a religious body.
meanings.sent1: The church's leaders guide the congregation with wisdom and compassion.
meanings.sent2: The church's council meets every week to discuss important matters.
meanings.sent3: The church's staff organized a fun event for the community last weekend.
meanings.sent4: The church's authority is respected by all members of the parish.
meanings.sent5: The church's minister delivered a powerful sermon that touched many hearts.
